patterns: Guide me on how to ask questions
responses:
To ask about a specific disease or condition, you can use phrases like:

'What is [disease name]?'
'What are the symptoms of [disease name]?'
'What causes [disease name]?'
'How to prevent [disease name]?'
'What are the treatment options for [disease name]?'

Replace [disease name] with the name of the disease or condition you want to know about. Be as specific as possible for the best response.
Why did the hipster burn his mouth? He drank the coffee before it was cool.
Why don't skeletons fight each other? They don't have the guts.
Why couldn't the bicycle stand up by itself? It was two-tired.
What did the buffalo say when his son left for college? Bison.
How do you organize a space party? You planet.
